materials.raw_text: Ce: 60 g, Er: 40 g, Tc: 30 g, Binder (e.g., epoxy resin): 150 g, Hardener for binder: 30 g, Filler (e.g., silica): 50 g, Release agent (e.g., mold release spray): 10 g.

sourcing.instructions: Ce (Cerium): available from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. Er (Erbium): can be sourced from specialized metal suppliers. Tc (Technetium): usually obtained from licensed radioactive material suppliers. Binder and hardener: available at craft stores or hardware stores. Filler (silica): can be found at construction supply stores. Release agent: available at craft stores or online.
steps: Ce (Cerium): available from chemical suppliers or online marketplaces. Er (Erbium): can be sourced from specialized metal suppliers. Tc (Technetium): usually obtained from licensed radioactive material suppliers. Binder and hardener: available at craft stores or hardware stores. Filler (silica): can be found at construction supply stores. Release agent: available at craft stores or online.

1. Measure 60 g of Ce, 40 g of Er, and 30 g of Tc using a precise scale. 2. In a mixing container, combine the measured metals. 3. Add 150 g of binder and 30 g of hardener to the metallic mixture. 4. Gradually add 50 g of silica filler while stirring continuously to ensure uniform distribution. 5. Mix thoroughly until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 6. Prepare a mold with dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches and apply 10 g of release agent evenly on the inner surfaces.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 60 g of Ce, 40 g of Er, and 30 g of Tc using a precise scale. 2. In a mixing container, combine the measured metals. 3. Add 150 g of binder and 30 g of hardener to the metallic mixture. 4. Gradually add 50 g of silica filler while stirring continuously to ensure uniform distribution. 5. Mix thoroughly until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 6. Prepare a mold with dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches and apply 10 g of release agent evenly on the inner surfaces.

steps: 1. Preheat an oven to 150째C (302째F). 2. Pour the mixture into the prepared mold and place it into the preheated oven. 3. Allow it to heat for 1 hour to cure the binder fully.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat an oven to 150째C (302째F). 2. Pour the mixture into the prepared mold and place it into the preheated oven. 3. Allow it to heat for 1 hour to cure the binder fully.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the oven and allow the mold to cool down naturally for about 2 hours. 2. Once cool to the touch, carefully remove the solidified sample from the mold.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the oven and allow the mold to cool down naturally for about 2 hours. 2. Once cool to the touch, carefully remove the solidified sample from the mold.

steps: 1. Inspect the sample for any surface imperfections. 2. If necessary, sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper (around 220 grit) to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability and appearance. 4. Allow any sealant to cure according to the manufacturer's instructions.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Inspect the sample for any surface imperfections. 2. If necessary, sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper (around 220 grit) to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability and appearance. 4. Allow any sealant to cure according to the manufacturer's instructions.
